main event: In February 1957, there was a ground-visual observation in Georgetown, Massachusetts of a bright unidentified object, which made a clockwise circuit and then moved out of sight. Ground personnel also observed an extremely bright stationary object that later disappeared.
interesting points: The observation lasted for one hour and was made by multiple witnesses, including officers and ground personnel.
The object was described as a bright light initially, remained stationary for a period, and then moved in a straight line out of sight.
No visible exhaust trail or sound was observed, and the object was viewed through 7 x 50 binoculars.
Several theories were considered, including the possibility of the object being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature.
The report indicates limited details, with insufficient data for a positive determination.
witnesses: multiple witnesses, including officers and ground personnel
